    Expressing possession with "you"

    (Redirected from ASGOOCVO)
    • Level
      A1 / HSK1
    • Level
      A1
    • Level
      HSK1
    • Similar to
      • Expressing existence with "you" (A1)
    • Similar to
      • Expressing existence with "you" (HSK1)
    • Used for
      Expressing possession
    • Keywords

    (yu) can be used in various ways, but the most basic meaning of this verb you need to know is "to have."

    Contents

    • 1 Structure
    • 2 Examples
    • 3 Negating (yu)
    • 4 See also
    • 5 Sources and further reading

    Structure

    Subj. + + Obj.

    Examples

    • W yu qin.I have money.
    • N yu fngzi ma?Do you have a house?
    • T mi yu ch.She doesn't have a car.
    • T yu npngyou ma?Does he have a girlfriend?
    • Wmen yu sn g n'r.We have three daughters.
    • Wmen ji yu ling g gngs.Our family has two companies.
    • N yu y bi kui qin ma?Do you have 100 kui RMB?
    • iPad N de losh yu iPad ma?Does your teacher have an iPad?
    • W bba mi yu gngzu.My dad doesn't have a job.
    • Jntin n yu k ma?Do you have classes today?

    Negating (yu)

    The verb (yu) is negated in a special way. Unlike most verbs, it is negated with (mi) instead of (b). The negative form of (yu) then, is (miyu). For more on that topic, see our article on negation of "you" with "mei."

    See also

    • Expressing existence with "you"
    • Negation of "you" with "mei"

    Sources and further reading

    • HSK Standard Course 1 (pp. 74) Anything Goes () buy
    • Chinese: An Essential Grammar, Second Edition (pp. 87-8) Anything Goes () buy
    • Integrated Chinese: Level 1, Part 1 (3rd ed) (pp. 53) Anything Goes () buy
    • New Practical Chinese Reader 1 (1) (pp. 105) Anything Goes () buy
    • New Practical Chinese Reader 1 (1)(2nd ed) (pp. 122-3) Anything Goes () buy
    • New Practical Chinese Reader 2 (2) (pp. 155) Anything Goes () buy
    • 40 Lessons for Basic Chinese Course (40 (pp. 300-1) [ buy]
    • 40 Lessons for Basic Chinese Course (40 (pp. 62, 73) [ buy]
